inclusion.criterion: children meeting criteria for any subtype of ADHD between the ages of 5-12 who are
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: not in full time school or less than 5 or older than 12 years at the time of the screening visit
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: history of seizures or other neurological problems and are taking medication to prevent seizures as stimulants could worsen seizures
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: cardiac arrhythmias, hypertension, Tourette's Disorder or history of severe tic exacerbations secondary to stimulant exposure
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: hypothyroidism, diabetes mellitus, liver or renal disease
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: children using prescription medication that can significantly impact appetite or weight are excluded
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: pervasive developmental disorder, schizophrenia or other psychotic disorders, bipolar disorder, post traumatic stress disorder, major depression with serious suicidal thoughts or an eating disorder as stimulants are not safe and effective treatments for these conditions, and these diseases could affect eating habits
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Body Mass Index is very low (too light for safe use of stimulant medication) or is too high (overweight so not suitable for weight promotion treatments)
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has Turner syndrome, delayed puberty and developmental delay. She is obese and mentally retarded.
